item.content:encoded:
University of Brighton Live Music Society

University of Sussex Rock and Metal Society

Presents

AltFreshers2012!

Brighton's Alternative Freshers Festival

7 Nights

45 Bands

7 Venues

Featuring acts from..

We are Fiction Loose Lips Scream Don't Whisper Esmerelda Jipsy Magic Young Electrics Mum Dad & the Kids Dead Empire Sweet Ether Sweet Johnny Three Against Four Fresh Like Dexie Hope Rudd March The Desert Wyrdforge King Goat Hole In The Sky

item.title: Welcome
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to the beginning, of The Brighton Alternative Freshers Festival - AltFreshers2012! We Might call it BAF 2012… but we can’t decide if that just sounds silly…!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
BRING THE NOISE - Burst forth into the festival without style or purpose other than noise and expression... 2 floors of Brightons best live music followed by some sneaky DJ sets TBA. Drinks deals throughout the night. Live Line-Up so far confirmed in no particular order:

Upstairs:

We are Fiction Loose Lips Scream Don’t Whisper Esmerelda

Down Below:

Jipsy Magic Young Electrics Mum Dad & the Kids

5 - for students in advance from Brighton and Sussex SU offices or online via the UBSU website from 20/09/12 6/7 - on the door
DJs and more TBA Get involved

University of Sussex Rock and Metal Society presents Brightons premier-Cru of ear splitting riffs... Followed by a mighty fine 'Guerilla Rocks' after Party downstairs at Audio - super cheap entry with your ticket/stamp

Featuring:

Dead Empire - http://www.facebook.com/deadempire Brighton's crunch gods, guaranteed to lay down one hell of a set, powerful voice and some huge anthems already under their belt... Be very excited. Mind of A Lion - http://www.facebook.com/Mindofalion Massive Morello-esque riffs an hard hitting vocals, right of the back of an incredible set at Rebellion festival. Sweet Ether - http://www.facebook.com/sweetether Sweet Johnny - http://www.facebook.com/sweeetjonny

£3/4 NUS on the door
Both events Strictly 18+ (ID Required)
Student drinks promos at both events.
The Blind Tiger Club, Grand Parade

Upstrokes, braces and a trilby, bald heads and horns. There will be bouncing and mighty skadub beats like you may never have seen before.
TOO MANY CROOKS After a HUGE set at our launch night, Brighton legends TMC return to our stage, there will be laughter, dancing and a lot of whiskey! www.facebook.com/TooManyCrooksFresh Like Dexie Soulful punk/funk/pop www.facebook.com/fresh.like.dexie Three Against Four Newborn Brighton Reggae with MC lines and a whole lot of bouncing www.facebook.com/threeagainstfour

£4 student tickets available in advance from Brighton and Sussex SU offices and via the UBSU website from 20/09/12
£5/6 on the door
Strictly 18+ (ID required)

University of Sussex Rock and Metal Society present Brighton's crunchiest and darkest doom and heavy metal. Followed by an exceptional 'Abandoned' Afterparty downstairs at Belushis until late. Featuring: Hole In The Sky, progressive death metal www.facebook.com/tearaholeinthesky March The Desert, stoner sludge metal www.facebook.com/marchthedesert Wyrdforge, blackened death metal www.facebook.com/pages/Wyrdforge/113572625350309 King Goat, old school doom metal www.facebook.com/kinggoatbri

£2 entry with your gig stamp.
Strictly 18+ (ID Required) Student drinks deals at both events

A true and almighty monster of a night. Masked and loud, this will be Brightons Halloween spectacle, prizes for best and worst dressed, ridiculous drinks deals for students. We have 2 floors of epic proportion and live Rock, Gypsy, Ska and punk for you to dance on down till the early hours. Followed by special guest DJs playing different themes, genres and odd surprises in every room. Live Line-Up - in No Particular Order: -*-*- Upstairs on 'The Devils Dancefloor' -*-*- Kids Can’t Fly www.facebook.com/kidscantfly Pistola Kicks www.facebook.com/pistolakicks The Slytones www.facebook.com/theslytones CLOWNS you.clowned.me/ soundcloud.com/c-l-o-w-n-s They Might Swim www.facebook.com/pages/They-Might-Swim/127484510681204 Downstairs - The Crypt  The Meow Meows Brightons biggest Brightest and funkiest Gypsy/Ska Kings and Queens, Masked ladies and Gentleman, you are in for an almighty treat with this one. Prepare to dance your heels and shin shoes to the sole. www.facebook.com/themeowmeows ZA/ZU abiflynn.bandcamp.com/

Entry: On-Sale from 20/09/12 £5 - Student advance from Brighton and Sussex SU offices and UBSU website £6/8 - On the door
Strictly 18+ (ID required for entry)

Blaggards, Pirate fancy dress be essential for plunders and mead... A full day line-up of Brightons quirkiest and loveliest acoustic and low-key musicians to close the weeks festivities. Beach BBQ and sweet snacks all day
Air guitar Competition Open-Mic Beach Busking (sign up at freshers fair or email info@altfreshers.co.uk)Line-up so far in no particular order:Dirty Scavenger https://www.facebook.com/dirtyscavenger Eris Acoustic folk-punk Zoë Hazel http://soundcloud.com/zoehazelhedderwick Young Electrics (acoustic) https://www.facebook.com/Youngelectrics Many more to be announced... See you there Brighton! AAARGH x
£1.50 in fancy dress / £3 without - tickets on the door Student drinks deals inside.
Who Are We, Why Are We Running a Festival?

The UBLMS was set up in November 2011, initially to link together music fans for live shows around Brighton, and inspire our passion for music in other students. After an impressive launch party on 19<sup>th</sup> April 2012 at the Hydrant, we decided to step things up a notch and really make an impression on the university and city scenes.
As first year students ourselves at Brighton University, we were forced to endure a long freshers week of force-fed commercialism, horrific repetitive club nights and cheesy pop/RnB music. This sickened us. This is our stand to make sure new Brighton, Sussex and BIMMs 2012/2013 students have the chance to see the true, artistic, diverse and exciting face of Brighton early in their time here and not have to fend for themselves from the off.
What’s The Point, Pop Culture Will Always be ‘Popular Culture’?

We appreciate this; we all have a massive range of music tastes and ideals for a night out in town… The main goal of the festival is, even if just for a short time, to take people away from the norm and display the alternative. Many students are unaware of Brighton’s mighty musical and artistic offerings, many people have never considered going to a ‘Ska Explosion’ night for a good old skank down, or seeing a recycled fashion collection, with fine bourbon, in a dingy bar, at 3am…
Our university can showcase both and so much more creativity! It’s all about new experience and opening minds. Also, for the many of us who are already well within the musical circle, it’s about putting on a huge show and impressive week of celebrations.

It’s not that kind of festival… We have organised a host of Brighton’s best venues for 7 nights of live entertainment and performance between 1700 and 0300 Mon-Sat and 1200-2200 on Sunday, you’ll have to stagger back to your own beds, or pray for a warm night on the beach, either way you’ll be leaving happy and psychologically blown away by the range of music and art!
Wow, Sounds Great, But Golly Gosh I’m a Student, I can’t Afford All That Legendary Awesomeness?!

You might be surprised, the events are aimed at us semi-impoverished student types, entry for individual nights will be between £4 & £6 with a Uni Card, that’ll get you an awesome night of live music and access to discount drinks at the venues. OR…
We’ll be rolling out £2-5 Advance tickets for the whole week at the UBSU campus offices, holding onto a set of these will get you entry to all events AND discounts for all UBLMS and Sussex RAMS events for 12 months… It’s an epic investment for the year.
We are currently organising (To name a few: Monthly showcase nights, Metal Slope (At Sussex Falmer Campus), A Zombocalypse-Before-Christmas-Ball, Summer Nights End-of-Exams Fiesta… MANY MORE…! It’s going to be a very exciting year!
OK, I’ll Have a Think About It, But I’m bored of Reading Now.

Brilliant, (discounted) Advance tickets will be on sale from 17<sup>th</sup> September from: Sussex and Brighton Uni Campus’, the venues and various other Brighton Promoters. If you want to find out more you can keep up to date with line-up announcements and gossip on our Facebook page, or UBSU site, or, just come and ask us, we’ll be in the pub and we’re a bloody friendly bunch!

A laid back night of meeting and greeting fellow Brighton music fans, brilliant upbeat acoustic and some open mic sets available. Come and say hello to your brand new Brighton live music society and get the run down on all of our events and how you could be involved! Student drinks deals and some informal board game competitions, with exceptional prizes, including free entry to the entire years schedule of events for 2 lucky winers! Featuring: Hope Rudd - myspace.com/lifeinice
19:30 until late 2/3 pounds on the door, 18+ event (ID required)

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hi, this is a comment.
To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickies to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!
